Content.p: Title: Recreational biking, walking, and blueway trails in Mobile and Baldwin Counties, Alabama; trails.shp
Abstract: This vector polyline shapefile represents all discoverable recreational biking, walking, and blueway trails in Mobile and Baldwin Counties, Alabama.

Purpose: This theme was created for coastal management purposes to meet project deliverables for coastal marine planning for coastal Alabama. Funding for this project was provided by the ADCNR State Lands Division, Coastal Section (ADCNR-Coastal), in part, by a grant from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Office of Ocean and Coastal Resource Management, Award No. 13NOS4190116.

can cause misrepresentation of the data. If enlarged, the

appropriate for mapping at the large scale. Digital data
files are periodically updated. Files are dated, and users
are responsible for obtaining the latest version of the data.
Native_Data_Set_Environment: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497

Process_Description: The GSA initiated this theme based on the completeness of the trail database located at http://maps.cityofmobile.org/GIS/gisdata_download.aspx. This site provided a thorough coverage within the City of Mobile area. Further trails were developed through data provided at http://www.bellingrath.org/, http://www.nps.gov/, https://www.traillink.com, http://www.mtbproject.com/, http://www.alabamabyways.com/, http://villagepointpark.com, http://www.americantrails.org/, http://www.alabamascenicrivertrail.com/, and http://hikealabama.org/. Because of poor resolution or lack of available trail mapping, trails within Blakeley State Park and Muddy Creek Wildlife Management Area were mapped in the field using GPS. GPS data were converted into decimal degrees, brought into GIS as a point theme, and the trails were digitized. Attributes reflecting trail name, trail type, and use were added if known.

Process_Description: The GSA collected GPS points for the Blakeley State Park located in Baldwin County. All points were brought into ArcGIS and were digitized into this shapefile. Trail names were added and geometery calculated.

Process_Description: A good resolution trail map of the 5 Rivers - Alabama's Delta Resource Center was georeferenced in ArcGIS where the trail network was digitized into this shapefile. The name attribute field was populated and geometry was calculated.
Unrepresentable_Domain: free text (usually paved or unpaved).
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail designated for automobile - scenic byway
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail (blueway) designated for canoeing or kayaking
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail (blueway) designated for power boat and paddle boat
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail designated for walking and biking
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail designated for walking, biking, and horse back riding
Enumerated_Domain_Definition: trail designated for walking or running
